snippet: President Obama’s naming of three nominees to a top appeals court is adding to a fight over whether the minority party in the Senate is too powerful.
abstract: President Obama's naming of three nominees to Court of Appeals for District of Columbia Circuit is adding fuel to larger fight on Capital Hill over whether minority party in Senate has too much power over president's agenda; court is typically considered second-most important in nation after Supreme Court, and currently has fairly conservative makeup.

byline.original: By MICHAEL D. SHEAR and JEREMY W. PETERS

lead_paragraph: President Obama’s naming of three nominees to a top appeals court is adding to a fight over whether the minority party in the Senate is too powerful.

headline.main: Judicial Picks Set the Stage for a Battle in the Senate
headline.print_headline: Judicial Picks Set the Stage For a Battle In the Senate
